_header: How is it how have ye forgotten me
_description:
Lady, have pity on me, a carole translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 251) — 25 lines in stanzas of varying lengths

BLHar682.First Lines:
HOw is hit how haue ye forgoten meYe certis ye y trowe it
                    verily…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…That to reward my loue ye ought ben sheHow is it
                    how
